description: This table contains information about the current event records.

columns.name: EVENT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the event record.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this event. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

columns.name: EVENT_DISPLAY_NAME
columns.description: The display name of the event.

columns.name: EVENT_TIME
columns.description: The instant when the event occurred.

columns.name: EVENT_RECORD_TIME
columns.description: The instant when the event was recorded.

columns.name: EVENT_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who initiated the event. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_EMP table.

columns.name: EVENT_CMT
columns.description: The comments entered for the event.

columns.name: EVENT_DEPT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the department in which this event was fired.

columns.name: ADT_EVENT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the Admission, Transfer, Discharge, or Leave of Absence (ADT) event record link that is associated with this event. The following ED events have linked ADT evens: ED Roomed (A) ED Transfer (T) ED Admit to Hospital (T)

columns.name: STAFFED_BEDS
columns.description: The number of staffed beds for a department at the time of the event. This item is populated only if you are using the Staffed Beds activity.

columns.name: EVENT_KEY
columns.description: A unique key associated with this event. The key is stored in other master files in order to reference this event.

columns.name: EVENT_NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the note that is associated with this event.

columns.name: EVENT_FINDING_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the result that is associated with this event. This column is frequently used to link to the ORDER_RES table.

columns.name: EVENT_IMPLANT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the implant that is associated with this event. This column is frequently used to link to the OR_IMP table.

columns.name: EVENT_LINE_DATA_ID
columns.description: The line number of the associated data stored for this event in OpTime's Log Entry activity. This column can be used to link to the OR_LNLG_GENERAL table.

columns.name: EVENT_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID associated with the provider record for this event. For example, an Assign Attending event stores the provider who was assigned in this column. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.

columns.name: LOCATION_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the patient location record that is associated with this event. This link is available only for emergency department contacts and for any location definition in the patient location facility master file that is associated with an event template master file. This column can be used to link to the CL_PLC table.

columns.name: EVENT_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the event's status.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active


Inactive


Deleted


Inactive and Deleted


Hidden


Inactive and Hidden


Deleted and Hidden


Inactive Deleted and Hidden

columns.name: REC_VERB_ORD_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The Inpatient reconciliation verbal order type flag category number for the event.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Ordering


Cosign


Discontinuing


Pending Discontinue


Edit


Delete


Continue on Transfer


Discontinue on Transfer


New on Transfer


Unreview on Transfer


Holding


Unholding


Order and Hold


Assigning Administration Responsibility

columns.name: REC_VRB_ORD_COMM_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who is the Inpatient reconciliation verbal order communicator for this event. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.

columns.name: REC_VRB_SIGNER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who is the Inpatient reconciliation verbal order signer for this event. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.

columns.name: REC_VRB_ORD_MODE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The Inpatient reconciliation verbal order mode category number for the event.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Verbal


Standard

columns.name: REC_ORD_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who is the Inpatient reconciliation ordering provider for this event. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.

columns.name: REC_PROC_AUTH_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who is the Inpatient reconciliation procedure authorizing provider for this event. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.

columns.name: REC_MED_AUTH_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who is the Inpatient reconciliation medication authorizing provider for this event. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.

columns.name: REC_PROC_MSG_RCP_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who is the Inpatient reconciliation procedure cosign message recipient for this event. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.

columns.name: REC_MED_MSG_RCP_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who is the Inpatient reconciliation medication cosign message recipient for this event. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_SER table.

columns.name: REC_IS_PROC_HOSP_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the Inpatient reconciliation procedure hospitalist flag is set for this event.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: REC_IS_MED_HOSP_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the Inpatient reconciliation medication hospitalist flag is set for this event.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: REC_IS_PROC_HOSP_YN

columns.name: REC_VERB_ORD_CMT
columns.description: The comments entered by the user who placed the Inpatient reconciliation verbal order associated with the event.

columns.name: REC_ADMIT_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number for the status of the Inpatient order reconciliation associated with this event.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: IP_REC_NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order reconciliation (process of reviewing a orders when the patient moves to another level or area of care) note that is the associated with this event.

columns.name: EVENT_LOG_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the surgical log that is associated with this event. This column is frequently used to link to the OR_LOG table.

columns.name: EVENT_SUPPLY_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the supply that is associated with "supply used" events generated in Cupid "add supply" workflows. This column should be used to link to the OR_SPLY table.

columns.name: EVENT_SUPPLY_ID_SUPPLY_NAME
columns.description: The name of the inventory item.

columns.name: EVENT_INI_RECORD_ID
columns.description: The master file and ID of the source of a duplicate procedure alert event. For example, this item usually holds LDG-ID (the ID of the procedure duplicate group used) or EAP-ID (the ID of the procedure used).

columns.name: EVENT_CONTEXT
columns.description: For some events, this column holds the context of the event. Lab Ordered events might store the order ID here. Duplicate procedure alert events might store information on specific user actions in response to the alert.

columns.name: SOURCE_PX_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the source procedure that is associated with this duplicate procedure check.

columns.name: SOURCE_PX_INFO
columns.description: Detailed information about the duplicate procedure checked in SOURCE_PX_ID.

columns.name: MATCH_PX_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the matched procedure that is associated with this duplicate procedure check.

columns.name: MATCH_PX_INFO
columns.description: Detailed information about the duplicate procedure checked in MATCH_PX_ID.

columns.name: EVENT_SIGN_OFF_ID
columns.description: The record that contains all the sign off information for this event.

columns.name: DEPT_SCORE
columns.description: Stores the numeric department score for department-specific events records. When a department scoring system is coordinated with a department event, the score calculated is saved in this item. It groups the score to the specific event instant, type, etc. from which the score was calculated.

columns.name: STAFF_ROLE_C_NAME
columns.description:
For a staff sign-in or sign-out event, this item holds what their role was when they signed in.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: STAFF_IS_ATTN_YN
columns.description:
For a staff sign-in or sign-out event, this item holds whether or not the user signed in as an attending provider.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: LINKED_IEV_REC_ID
columns.description: When linking two events, this item holds the record ID of the linked event. Use this in combination with the line number.

columns.name: LINKED_IEV_LINE
columns.description: When linking two events, this item holds the line number of the linked event within its respective record. Use this in combination with the record ID.

columns.name: EVENT_TYPE_VERSION
columns.description: If the data model for a particular event type changes, this item can be used to say which version of the data model is being used. Assume that blank is version 1. The version number only has meaning in relation to EVENT_TYPE.

columns.name: EVENT_OWNER_ID
columns.description: Stores the owner of the event.

columns.name: PEND_ACTIVE_C_NAME
columns.description:
This column shows the current pend (group of pended orders) status. Each pend type has a separate active status. A pend can also have a status of cleanup needed. A null status is used for pends that are no longer in use.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active Public


Active Private


Cleanup Needed

columns.name: PEND_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The status of the pended orders.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active Public


Active Private


Restored


Deleted


Expired


Replaced

columns.name: PEND_RESTORED_BY_ID
columns.description: Unique ID of the user who restored the pended orders.

columns.name: PEND_RESTORED_DTTM
columns.description: Instant the pended orders were restored.

columns.name: PEND_DELETED_BY_ID
columns.description: Unique ID of the user who deleted pended orders.

columns.name: PEND_DELETED_I_DTTM
columns.description: The instant pended orders were deleted.

columns.name: PEND_COMMENT
columns.description: User or autogenerated comment about the pended orders.

columns.name: PEND_CHANGE_COUNT
columns.description: Count of number of changes from a user perspective (some actions will not count as changes)

columns.name: PEND_INSTANT_DTTM
columns.description: Instant that the pended orders were created.

columns.name: PEND_CREATE_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Category indicating how these orders were pended such as automatically on timeout.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Normal/Default


Automatically Saved


Automatically Saved When Another User Logged In


Saved on Closing Chart


Automatically Saved on Timeout


Context Changed


Automatically Saved on Encounter Department Change

columns.name: EVENT_OVRIDE_RSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores override reason for not scanning patient to verify the event.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: EVENT_LABEL
columns.description: The label for the value associated with an event.

columns.name: EVENT_VALUE
columns.description: The value associated with an event.

columns.name: NOTIFY_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
Store the current status for a bed planning notification


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active


Resolved


Resolved Through Notification


Dismissed


No Longer Valid

columns.name: NOTIFY_PND_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
Store the status of why a bed request is being escalated


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Ready to Plan


Assigned


Rejected


Approved


Requested


Pre-assigned


Bed Ready

columns.name: AN_LINKED_EVENT_ID
columns.description: Stores the record ID of an event that is linked to another Anesthesia event.

columns.name: AN_LINKED_EVENT_LINE
columns.description: When linking an Anesthesia event to another event, this item holds the line number of the linked event within its respective record.

columns.name: ED_C_CLIENT_SRC_C_NAME
columns.description:
This tracks from what client the user filed an ED Course event.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Hyperspace


Limerick


Haiku


Canto

columns.name: CT_EVENT_FILED_BY_C_NAME
columns.description:
If an event was filed automatically by a Case Tracking Event, this item holds the category ID of the case tracking event that did it


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: TRANSPORT_ID
columns.description: This item stores the ID of the transport request that triggered the event, if applicable.

columns.name: TXPORT_HLR_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the logistics patient transport request (HLR) that triggered the event.

columns.name: EVENT_ORIGIN_C_NAME
columns.description:
This indicates whether the event came from an internal or external source. If blank, the event came from an internal source.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Internal


External
